Posts.Content: Thank you Riley for your help in pointing me to the right group. Posts.Title: Penguin Cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi, tomorrow I have my first cycle of AC chemo and am going to give Penguin cold capping a try as my mother is ill and does not know I have BC. If it doesn't  work I have got a wig on standby. Does anyone know if I do lose a lot of hair, can I wear my wig in between sessions?  Can I  wash my hair tomorrow before the treatment or not? I feel more nervous today at the thought of have chemo than I did before I had the masectomy which is very odd.  If anyone is also having there first session tomorrow or is already on the journey please can you let me know how you are doing x
Posts.Title: June chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, I was interested in your post, I was told at my first oncologist appointment that it was unecessary for me to have chemo, he advised that I took Letrozole for 5 -10 years, but they were running a clinical trial for Endopredict and suggested that I might like to take part. When I returned I was told my score was 3.4 and chemo was strongerly advised. I have had my first cycle of AC chemo and have had bad SE including a uti. I am just wondering if I have made the right decision.  I would be very interested in anyone experiences. Thanks x
Posts.Title: oncoDX result

Posts.Content: Hi, can anyone help please with some information.   A year ago I  had a masectomy and reconstruction, plus chemotherapy. I have recently had a scan on the remaining breast which was called 'busy' by my surgeon,  the scan results came back ok. Whilst I am very pleased, I am wondering does anyone check the masectomy side?   This is such a wonderful site, I always read the posts and gain so much information from you all. Sonia x
